jutils

Class Trace

  • java.lang.Object
    • jutils.DebugStatus
      • jutils.Trace

  • public class Trace
extends DebugStatus
    The Trace class combines the writing program information to StdOut and to files using a common set of tools. An extension of DebugStatus, it allows for "Debugging Trace messages" to be with written to a "Trace" file, or for those messages to not be written. Methods are also available to format information in the Errs class in a standard way, as well as the ability to display "Separator Lines" in files and to the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trace

        public Trace(java.lang.String tfName,
             Trace tr)
        Constructor for file based trace files or for initial program tracing.

        If the Trace File Name passed is null, then tracing will go to System.out.

        Methods are coded so that printing to the trace file or System Out will print exactly the same.

        If the Trace File Name is blank, the default name will be used. Otherwise the passed in file will be used.

        When opened, if the Trace file exists, the file will be appended to, not overwritten.

        Note that the file will not be opened until the first message is to be written. At which time a "Opened" date/time stamp will be written to the file.

        If the file close routine is called, and it may not due to the program ending in a error, a "Closed" date/time stamp will be written to the file before it is closed.

        Parameters:
        tfName - string value of the name of the trace file, or null;
        tr - a previously instantiated Trace class, or null. This parameter is provided so that a class can trace to a file to begin with, and then create a trace window but not have to initialize all of the debug states again.

      • Trace

        public Trace(TraceThread traceWindow,
             TraceThread userMsgWindow,
             Trace tr)
        Constructor for GUI based Trace Windows or for initial program tracing.

        Two windows are used for Gui based apps. One is for the "Trace Messages" and the other is for normal messages that would be displayed to the the user. So a message to be "printed" would go to the "User Message Window" while a 'Debug' or 'Trace' message would go to the "Trace Window". This just makes it easier to seperate the debugging info from the normal output.

        If the gui flag is set to true, then all trace routines are sent to the appropriate TraceThreads. If the flag is set to anything else, then tracing will go to either the Trace file or to System.out.

        Methods are coded so that printing to the trace window or System Out will print exactly the same.

        When opened, if the Trace window exists, the window will be appended to, not overwritten.

        Note that the neither the User Message Window, nor the Trace window, will not be opened until the first message is to be written. At which time a "Opened" date/time stamp will be written to the window.

        If the Trace window close routine is called, and it may not due to the stopping in a error, a "Closed" date/time stamp will be written to the window before it is closed.

        Parameters:
        traceWindow - TraceThread instance to handle GUI trace Requests when a thread has been created to handle windows.
        May be set to null, to indicate that all trace messages are sent to System.out; otherwise the trace messages are sent to the TraceThread
        userMsgWindow - TraceThread instance to handle GUI "print" Requests when a thread has been created to handle windows.
        May be set to null, to indicate that these messages are sent to System.out; otherwise the messages are sent to the userMsgWindow
        tr - a previously instantiated Trace class, or null. This parameter is provided so that a class can trace to a file to begin with, and then create a trace window but not have to initialize all of the debug states again.

    • Method Detail

      • getErrs

        public Errs getErrs()
        Returns the most recent error information
        Returns:
        Errs class containing the most recent error information

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the Trace instance. While not "required" to be called, it does help in locating the "end" of a run in the trace file.

        For file based Traces, a clean up method tClose is called to close the actual file. For GUI based Traces, the Trace window is closed.

        The trace variables are reset to null, in case the program decides to reuse the instance again without calling the constructor (to print messages to StdOut.

        public void printFmt(java.lang.String title,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Displays a formatted message. Used to display Field names or descriptions and values. The "name" is defaulted to 40 characters with two additional preceding spaces.
        Parameters:
        title - string value to print first
        value - string value to print second

      • debugSep

        public void debugSep(java.lang.String cDCode)
        Displays a debugging message separator
        Parameters:
        cDCode - String value of a DebugInfo Debug Method Code.

      • debugSep

        public void debugSep(java.lang.String cDCode,
                     java.lang.String sType)
        Display a separator line in the trace, if debugging
        Parameters:
        cDCode - String value of a DebugInfo Debug Method Code.
        sType - string value equal to one of the following values:
        • TRACE_SEP_BEGIN - prints a "Beginning" separator line
        • TRACE_SEP_END - prints an "Ending" separator line
        • TRACE_SEP_STAR - prints a star separator line
        • TRACE_SEP_DOUBLE - prints a "double" separator line
        • anything else - prints a dash separator line

      • debugErr

        public void debugErr(java.lang.String cDCode,
                     java.lang.String dPreFix,
                     Errs err)
        Displays the current error message on Trace output
        Parameters:
        cDCode - String value of a DebugInfo Debug Method Code.
        dPreFix - string to be written in front of error to distinguish its origin
        err - Errs class with the error values set

        public void debugFmt(java.lang.String cDCode,

        cDCode - String value of a DebugInfo Debug Method Code.
        dPreFix - string to be written in front of error to distinguish its origin
        title - string description to print first
        value - string value to print second

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug(java.lang.String cDCode)
        Determines if we are debugging a specific class. If debugging hasn't been defined, or we are not debugging the class, a false value is returned, otherwise a true value is returned.
        Parameters:
        cDCode - String value of the Class Debug Code to be checked
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating if debugging is initiated for the the class specified by cDCode

      • traceSep

        public void traceSep(java.lang.String sType)
        Display a Beginning, Ending, or General separator line in the trace
        Parameters:
        sType - string value equal to one of the following values:
        • TRACE_SEP_BEGIN - prints a "Beginning" separator line
        • TRACE_SEP_END - prints an "Ending" separator line
        • TRACE_SEP_STAR - prints a star separator line
        • TRACE_SEP_DOUBLE - prints a "double" separator line
        • anything else - prints a dash separator line

      • traceErr

        public void traceErr(Errs err,
                     java.lang.String message)
        Displays a message, based on the Errs values, with an optional message string, to the user, either directly on System.out, on the gui Window, or to a file.
        Parameters:
        err - Errs class with the error values set
        message - String message to be displayed may be empty

        value - string value to print second

        Returns:

      • getAllVersions

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllVersions(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vlist)
        Returns list of mapped pairs of class file names and the version number. It also adds all called routines to the list. If the class file name and version is already in the list, it does not add them, it simply returns.
        Parameters:
        vlist - Map of the current class/versions to be appended to
        Returns:
        Map of the class/version values for this and all called routines
